    lineplots

    Prepare data for plotting a barplot.

    prep_no_trend.Rd

    Prepare data for plotting a barplot.

    Usage

    prep_no_trend(
  dat,
  columns,
  competence,
  grouping_var = "",
  group_var = "group",
  state_var = "TR_BUNDESLAND",
  competence_var = "kb",
  states = NULL,
  sig_niveau = 0.05,
  parameter = "mean"
)

    Arguments

    dat

    Input data.frame stemming from eatRep.

    columns

    Character string containing the column in data that contains the column names for the table_plot.

    competence

    Character string containing the competence that should be plotted.

    grouping_var

    Character string containing the column name in dat that should be used to distinguish between subgroups.

    group_var

    Character string containing the column name in dat that contains the different group memberships in one string. Defaults to "group".

    state_var

    Character string containing the column name in dat that should be used to distinguish between groups that should be plotted seperatly. Normally, this should be the states ("Bundesländer"). Therfore, defaults to "TR_BUNDESLAND".

    competence_var

    Character string containing the column name in dat that contains the different competences. Defaults to "kb".

    states

    Character vector of the states that should be plotted.

    sig_niveau

    Numeric indicating the border, below which p-values will be considered significant. Defaults to 0.05.

    parameter

    Character string of the parameter value that should be reported. Defaults to "mean".

    Value

    Returns a data.frame which can be used as input for plot_bar.

    Examples
